intro: Epidendrum conspicuum, commonly known as the showy epidendrum, is a tropical orchid native to Central and South America. It is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that range in color from white to pink and purple. The plant typically grows as an epiphyte, attaching itself to trees in humid, shaded environments. Its leaves are broad and革质 (leathery), and it produces long, branching inflorescences. Epidendrum conspicuum is prized in horticulture for its ornamental value and relatively easy care requirements.
